message: http://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/googleplus.png
Pretty much my thought on this. Got an invite, but can't log in at the moment to see what it's all about.
The mouseover is even better than the strip.
Especially because it's true!
Does anyone need an invite to G+?
Added you should get the invite.
I wouldn't mind one please : ) I need another social network to sign onto and completely forget about. Heh.
lanceha AT gmail
Thanks Neil
I'm playing around with it at the moment. Not sure what to think just yet.
I have my invite, but getting a full capacity message. :\
Same on this side. Been trying the whole day with no luck.
Try it now, I just got in.
So far, I'm unimpressed.

No! I just realized something awesome which hadn't clicked yet. (Apologies if this is explained in the videos.) Adding someone to a circle is a one way relationship, as on Twitter - so anyone's free to add you, without you having to add them back (i.e. schoolmates)
Played around with it at the moment. Still trying to make my mind up about it. The Circles thing is pretty neat though, I like the way it's implemented.
I'm not even bothering. There is enough taking up my time these days
The most astonishing thing about G+ so far, in my opinion, is that they managed to lure Andy Hertzfeld(!!) out of decades of retirement to design the UI.
It is still early days, but I really do like the Circle idea. You can add the same friends to multiple circles.

I love that this is fully integrated into the top bar in Gmail (my de facto email client).

All they need to do now is ditch Buzz, and hopefully the niche that that fills will migrate to G+.
